creditline: Gift of John Robert and Birgitte Christianson
description: two figures at center, surrounded by decorative floral motif; female figure on L in blue dress appears to be tending to a plant; male figure on R in floral tunic and blue cloak holding a rope that is tethered to the leg of a bird flying above both people; brown, green, and gold two-legged, horned creature at feet of people
medium: Wool, silk; gros point and petit point
text: This needlepoint textile may have been used originally as a fire screen or framed. Embroideries like these were typically manufactured within the home by leisured women in elite families and were often used for home furnishings such as wall hangings, cushions, and furniture coverings. The peak period for this type of needlework spanned the late 1500s to the early 1800s.
title: Embroidered textile
